main event: A yellow star-like object was observed in Tarrytown, N.Y., initially reported on August 9, 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed in a southeasterly direction at a very high altitude,The size of the object was estimated to be 5 or 6 times that of the North Star,The sighting was confirmed by three police officers including one with a commercial pilot's license,The object was described as yellowish and eight times the size of any star in the sky,The object hovered and moved generally southward before disappearing.
witness description: police officers including a commercial pilot
